itemDescription: British Army general and governor in Canada (1783-1859)

wikipedia_page.main: General Charles Murray Cathcart, 2nd Earl Cathcart  (21 December 1783 – 16 July 1859), styled Lord Greenock between 1814 and 1843, was a British Army general who became Governor General of the Province of Canada (26 November 1845 – 30 January 1847). He was a keen amateur geologist, with enough recognition to warrant being made a Fellow of the Royal Society of Edinburgh.

response: ====Charles Cathcart, 2nd Earl Cathcart and Baron Greenock (1845–1847)====
* July 16 – Charles Cathcart, 2nd Earl Cathcart, British army general and colonial administrator (b. 1783)
